Activity2.Description: BIG READ PROGRAM - THE BIG READ IS A PROGRAM OF THE NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR THE ARTS DESIGNED TO RESTORE READING TO THE CENTER OF AMERICAN CULTURE.

Activity3.Description: STRATEGIC COMMUNITY IMPACT PLAN (SCIP) - THE STRATEGIC COMMUNITY IMPACT PLAN IS A JOINT EFFORT OF THE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION OF WASHINGTON COUNTY AND THE UNITED WAY OF WASHINGTON COUNTY. THE GOAL OF SCIP IS TO JOIN EFFORTS AND IDENTIFY AND ESTABLISH GOALS IN THE AREAS OF PEOPLE, FAMILIES, AND COMMUNITY.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE INTENDED USES OF THE THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE TO PROVIDE OPERATING FUNDS FOR THE DESIGNATED ORGANIZATIONS. Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION FOLLOWS THE FASB ACCOUNTING STANDARDS CODIFICATION, WHICH PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES RECOGNIZED IN AN ENTITY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE GUIDANCE PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT ATTIRIBUTE FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN, AND ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON DERECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS, DISCLOSURES, AND TRANSITION. AS OF JUNE 30, 2010, THE FOUNDATION HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FOUNDATION'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION'S POLICY IS TO RECOGNIZE INTEREST AND PENALTIES ON UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS IN INCOME TAX EXPENSE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. NO INTEREST AND PENALTIES WERE RECORDED DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2010. GENERALLY, THE TAX YEARS BEFORE 2007 ARE NO LONGER SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL TAXING AUTHORITIES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990 IS PROVIDED AT A BOARD MEETING FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION REQUIRES THAT THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY BE REVIEWED ANNUALLY AT THE BOARD MEETING. EVERY MEMBER IS PROVIDED A COPY OF THE POLICY TO REVIEW AND IS REQUIRED TO SIGN, ACKNOWLEDGING THAT HE/SHE RECEIVED AND UNDERSTOOD THE POLICY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPENSATION THAT IS RECEIVED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED, REVIEWED, AND APPROVED BY THE INDEPENDENT VOTING MEMBERS AT THE BOARD MEETINGS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES IT GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AT THE ORGANIZATION'S OFFICE DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS.
NO CHANGE IN THE PROCESS HAS BEEN MADE FROM THE PRIOR YEAR TO THE CURRENT YEAR.
